data.title: Philip Carteret FRS (abt.1641-1672)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Explore genealogy for Philip Carteret FRS born abt. 1641  died 1672 Solebay, Suffolk, England including ancestors + descendants + 6 genealogist comments + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Born about 1641 [location unknown]

Problems/Questions

Profile last modified 19 Jun 2022 | Created 9 Jul 2015

This page has been accessed 1,850 times.

Contents

1 Biography

2 Death

2.1 Research Notes

2.2 Will

2.3 Notes

3 Sources

Biography

Sir Philip Carteret was a member of the aristocracy in England.

Philip Carteret FRS is Notable.

Sir Philip Carteret married Jemima, daughter of Edward Montague, the First Earl of Sandwich.[1]

Death

Death: Killed at the first naval battle of the 3rd Anglo-Dutch war being "blown up" in the ship the "Royal James" with his father in law Lord Sandwich, according to the source information. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philip_Carteret_FRS gives "Prince Royal".

Date: 28 MAY 1672

Place: Solebay, Suffolk, England

Research Notes

Notes from NJ Calendar of Wills, page xxx: "When New Jersey was granted (March 12, 1664) by Charles II. to the Duke of York, and by him (June 23-24, 1664) to the Lords Proprietors—Lord John Berkley and Sir George Carteret—the latter appointed Philip Carteret (February 10, 1664-5) to be Governor of New Jersey."

" That is, after the transfer of the ownership and government of East Jersey from the Lords Proprietors, by whom Philip Carteret had been appointed Governor, to the Twelve Proprietors, and their taking possession of the territory and government."

Sir Philip Carteret is an ancestor of Prince William, the Duke of Cambridge.

Will

1682 Dec. 10. Carteret, Philipp, of Elizabethtown; will of. N. J. Archives, XXL, p. 52. [2]

Note: #N187.

Notes

Note N187Knighted By The King In 1667. 1

Fellow of the Royal Society,Gentelman of the Kings Chamber,1670.

Sources

↑ Page 84 New Jersey Calendar of Wills. https://ia800902.us.archive.org/14/items/calendarofnewjer00newj/calendarofnewjer00newj.pdf
